Hack, Punt, Tool

Music by Julie Henion Lyrics by Daniel Levine Book by Zach Barryte, Rachel Bowens-Rubin, and Danbee Kim

Hack, Punt,Tool is an original musical about a fictional group of MIT students who are working together to build an anonymous technological prank, or a "hack." The story follows the adventures of a freshman, Billie Rogers, who wants to join the hackers so he can be hardk0re. As the campus police, romantic entanglements, and old misunderstandings challenge the success of the hack, the hackers learn to trust in their friends and discover how to deal with exclusion, self-respect, and forgiveness.

The February 5 showing will be followed by a talkback with the writers and creative team of Hack, Punt, Tool.

Learn more about the show at hackpunttool.com.

Performances February 3-4 & 9-11 at 8 PM, and February 5 at 2 PM in La Sala de Puerto Rico
Reviews:
  • The Tech
